A - ***Resource*** : Cisco NX-OS SDK

I see the NX-OS SDK is to enable the automation.
About the NX-SDK
The Cisco NX-OS SDK (NX-SDK) is a C++ abstraction and plugin-library layer that streamlines access to infrastructure for automation and custom application creation, such as generating custom:
CLIs
Syslogs

Installing and Running Custom Applications
You can install applications by copying binaries to the switch, or installing unpacking the binaries from the RPM package.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure Cisco Nexus devices and wants to automate this workflow. The engineer enables the Cisco NX-OS REST API to configure the devices by using an Ansible playbook. Before running the code, which resource must be used to verify that the code works correctly?

discussion.content:
Tricky one...A & B are best candidates, but 'git merge' is performed whilst in the MASTER Branch and so you are pulling not pushing the changes from the branch into the MASTER.
Hence, I think A i s best answer.

A.
https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/using-branches/git-merge

Selected Answer: A
merge command is used for merging.
Very obvious

Selected Answer: A
A is the right answer:
Git merge will combine multiple sequences of commits into one unified history. In the most frequent use cases, git merge is used to combine two branches.
The merge process in Git is used to handle the combining of multiple branches into one.
B is incomplete but still seems the only viable answer for me.

comments.content: He's almost never right, says a lot of wrong things... not only on this exam but also others, I suspect it's a troll
After rethinking, I believe A seems to be the most accurate one.

choices.A: Combine multiple sequences of commits into one unified history
choices.C: Create, list, rename, and delete branches
choices.B: Push changes to the remote repository

questions.question_text: Which action does the Git command git merge allow the developer to perform?
